revised_title: Structural and Evolutionary Relationships of Prolamin Storage Proteins in Cereals
tldr: The article discusses the major endosperm storage proteins of wheat, barley, and rye, known as prolamins. It presents a classification of these proteins based on their chemical characteristics and genetic control, and explores their structural and evolutionary relationships. The study provides insights into the origin and evolution of these proteins and their importance in determining the nutritional and functional qualities of the grains.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
